body:
$! You must tell DVLA if you suffer from a personality disorder and it affects your driving. $!

If you're unsure whether your personality disorder affects your driving, consult your doctor.

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA if your personality disorder affects your driving. Fill in the M1 questionnaire and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘M1 - Medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 252KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066650.pdf "Download ‘M1 medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 252KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA if your personality disorder affects your driving. Fill in the M1V questionnaire and send to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘M1V - Medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 243KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_172725.pdf "Download ‘M1V medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 243KB)"){:rel="external"} $D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency

title: Personality disorder and driving
